comment.narrative: Inception Period 0.1 Project team will be established and Project Office will be prepared. 0.2 Institutional Identity for the Project will be prepared. 0.3 Communication and Visibility activities will be conducted. 0.4 Consultants will be recruited. 0.5 PMU meetings and Project Steering Committee will be held. Implementation Period 1.1. Updating Turkey’s experience on industrial symbiosis through literature review, synergy development with previous and already existing initiatives will be searched and made available as available resource documents. 1.2. Updating information with regards to available platforms and similar best practices around the world for industrial symbiosis will be analysed and elaborately reviewed. 1.3 Updating the methodology will be developed to establish the best suitable platform for İzmir Region’s industrial symbiosis programme. 2.1. Identifying partners such as universities, research institutions that would foster industrial symbiosis initiatives in technical terms. 2.2. Identifying private sector partners, that are voluntary for industrial symbiosis, and would act like anchor tenant for IRISP, such as iron and steel industry in Aliağa Region. 2.3. Supporting 7 PhD thesis in the field of industrial symbiosis in İzmir Region with the partnership of university, government, and private sector.

Inception Period 0.1 The human resources were deployed, and the project office was prepared. A project coordination unit (PCU) which compose of the UNDP and IZKA staff specifically for this project was established. A detailed workplan for the first year was prepared. A kick-off meeting and the launch event of the project was conducted. 0.2 A communication strategy and implementation were prepared for the project to outline the target group of the project, the tone of communication, creation of institutional identity, brand management for the project including web site, logo, etc. Project video and first two newsletter was prepared. The project website is established. 0.3 Communication and Visibility activities are (i) Project Visibility Materials (vacuum flask, cloth bag and erasable notebook) are designed, manufactured, and shared with the Project Team both in Ankara and İzmir. All materials either have projects logo and projects partners logo with the QR code of project web site on them or both. (ii) Project web site has been published. (iii) Project video and newsletters have been prepared and published on the web site. (iv) Summary Report for Industrial Symbiosis Background in Turkey has prepared and revised. 0.4 Contracts signed with the Chief Technical Advisor and wşth the National Consultant. 0.5 Two PMU meetings and first Project Steering Committee was held. Implementation Period 1.1. A Draft Summary Report and Final Summary Report on review of existing literature on Turkey’s up to date experience in industrial symbiosis including literature review were prepared to introduce industrial symbiosis concept, its evolution history in the world and what has been done so far in Turkey. The report also has a section for lessons learnt from so far implemented projects and recommendations for a more successful implementation for the PMU. 1.2. A Draft Summary Report and Final Summary Report on review of existing platforms internationally was prepared to analyse the functioning mechanisms, outputs, and successful cases to be able to provide an international know-how in this field. Several meetings are conducted so far, for this activity with PMU, CTA, and National Consultant. This activity is in progress and will be finalized in 2022. 1.3 A platform and methodology report were outlined to analyse different approaches and discusses advantages and disadvantages of these approaches and finally proposes a methodology for Turkey’s industrial symbiosis programme. Several meetings are conducted so far, for this activity with PMU, CTA, and National Consultant for Component 1. This activity is in progress and will be finalized in 2022. 2.1. Preparation of the list of partners in academics present with Expression of their interest in taking part in this Industrial Symbiosis Programme is initiated. 2.2. The team was already visited Atatürk OIZ, Aliağa OIZ, Menemen Plastik Specialized OIZ, Tire OIZ, Pancar OIZ, Aegean Free Zone, Izmir Bilimpark during the fieldwork that started with the Aegean Region Chamber of Industry, Izmir Chamber of Commerce, Izmir Commodity Exchange, and Aegean Exporters Association. Preparation of the list of private sectors/industries is present with Expression of their interest in taking part in this Industrial Symbiosis Programme is initiated. 2.3. Several meetings are conducted so far, for this activity with TUBITAK for the cooperation. TUBITAK verbally agreed on the details of the programme. A Project Cooperation Agreement is being drafted to be made between TUBITAK and UNDP. This activity is in progress and will be finalized in 2022.

Training private sector, central and provincial government institutions, universities, municipalities on industrial symbiosis and international best practices. 4.2. Identifying potential options for industrial symbiosis in the field of energy, raw materials, waste, water, human resources, etc.
